Package org.neo4j.storageengine.api

Interface StorageEngine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Lifecycle
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RecordStorageEngine
    public interface StorageEngine
extends Lifecycle
    A StorageEngine provides the functionality to durably store data, and read it back.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • newCommandCreationContext

        CommandCreationContext newCommandCreationContext​(PageCursorTracer cursorTracer,
                                                 MemoryTracker memoryTracker)
        Returns:
        a new CommandCreationContext meant to be kept for multiple calls to createCommands(Collection, ReadableTransactionState, StorageReader, CommandCreationContext, ResourceLocker, long, TxStateVisitor.Decorator, PageCursorTracer, MemoryTracker). Must be closed after used, before being discarded.

      • createCommands

        void createCommands​(Collection<StorageCommand> target,
                    ReadableTransactionState state,
                    StorageReader storageReader,
                    CommandCreationContext creationContext,
                    ResourceLocker locks,
                    long lastTransactionIdWhenStarted,
                    TxStateVisitor.Decorator additionalTxStateVisitor,
                    PageCursorTracer cursorTracer,
                    MemoryTracker memoryTracker)
             throws KernelException
        Generates a list of commands representing the changes in the given transaction state (state. The returned commands can be used to form CommandsToApply batches, which can be applied to this storage using apply(CommandsToApply, TransactionApplicationMode). The reason this is separated like this is that the generated commands can be used for other things than applying to storage, f.ex replicating to another storage engine.
        Parameters:
        target - Collection to put commands into.
        state - ReadableTransactionState representing logical store changes to generate commands for.
        storageReader - StorageReader to use for reading store state during creation of commands.
        creationContext - CommandCreationContext to use for do contextualized command creation e.g. id allocation.
        locks - ResourceLocker can grab additional locks. This locks client still have the potential to acquire more locks at this point. TODO we should try to get rid of this locking mechanism during creation of commands The reason it's needed is that some relationship changes in the record storage engine needs to lock prev/next relationships and these changes happens when creating commands The EntityLocker interface is a subset of Locks.Client interface, just to fit in while it's here.
        lastTransactionIdWhenStarted - transaction id which was seen as last committed when this transaction started, i.e. before any changes were made and before any data was read.
        additionalTxStateVisitor - any additional tx state visitor decoration.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        memoryTracker - to report allocations to
        Throws:
        KernelException - on known errors while creating commands.

      • apply

        void apply​(CommandsToApply batch,
           TransactionApplicationMode mode)
    throws Exception
        Apply a batch of groups of commands to this storage.
        Parameters:
        batch - batch of groups of commands to apply to storage.
        mode - TransactionApplicationMode when applying.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs during application.

      • flushAndForce

        void flushAndForce​(IOLimiter limiter,
                   PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
            throws IOException
        Flushes and forces all changes down to underlying storage. This is a blocking call and when it returns all changes applied to this storage engine will be durable.
        Parameters:
        limiter - The IOLimiter used to moderate the rate of IO caused by the flush process.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Throws:
        IOException - on I/O error.

      • dumpDiagnostics

        void dumpDiagnostics​(Log errorLog,
                     DiagnosticsLogger diagnosticsLog)
        Dump diagnostics about the storage.
        Parameters:
        errorLog - to which to log error messages.
        diagnosticsLog - to which to log diagnostics messages.

      • forceClose

        void forceClose()
        Force close all opened resources. This may be called during startup if there's a failure during recovery or similar.

      • listStorageFiles

        Collection<StoreFileMetadata> listStorageFiles()
        Returns:
        a Collection of StoreFileMetadata containing metadata about all store files managed by this StorageEngine.

      • getStoreId

        StoreId getStoreId()
        Returns:
        the StoreId of the underlying store.

      • schemaAndTokensLifecycle

        Lifecycle schemaAndTokensLifecycle()
        The life cycle that is used for initialising the token holders, and filling the schema cache.

      • metadataProvider

        MetadataProvider metadataProvider()
        Returns:
        a MetadataProvider, provides access to underlying storage metadata information.

      • countsAccessor

        CountsAccessor countsAccessor()

      • newReader

        StorageReader newReader()
        Creates a new StorageReader for reading committed data from the underlying storage. The returned instance is intended to be used by one transaction at a time, although can and should be reused for multiple transactions.
        Returns:
        an interface for accessing data in the storage.
